thread.title: Northgate teams clinch state berth; Hasberger 2nd
thread.title_full: Northgate teams clinch state berth; Hasberger 2nd

title: Northgate teams clinch state berth; Hasberger 2nd
text:
Northgate teams clinch state berth; Hasberger 2nd Sunday, October 25, 2015 Comments 
Northgate’s boys and girls varsity cross-country teams advanced to next month’s GHSA Championships after finishing third and fourth, respectively, at Saturday’s Region 4- meet at Heritage Christian Church in Fayetteville. 
Lady Vikings junior Elise Glorvigen led a pair of top-10 finishes individually for Northgate’s girls while sophomore Hayden Hasberger’s runner-up effort highlighted two for the Vikings. 
Hasberger crossed in 16:22 only six seconds behind Starr’s Mill freshman Harrison Fultz to lead Northgate’s boys to a state berth. 
McIntosh’s boys and Union Grove’s girls won team championships, with the top-four schools qualifying for the Class Championships on the state course in Carrollton. 
Glorvigen was the Lady Vikings’ top finisher in 19:29 while placing sixth in heated competition between runners from Starr’s Mill, McIntosh and Union Grove — all of whom also qualified for state as a team. 
Union Grove had four of the top eight finishers, including region runner-up Ellude Montgomery (19:05) and freshman Mackenzie Cromer, who took third (19:06) while a second apart. 
Starr’s Mill sophomore Mary Valli won the individual region crown in 18:58 among two Lady Panthers in the top-five with teammate Sophie Handel (5th, 19:26). McIntosh was led by Alyssa LeClaire’s fourth-place finish in 19:08. 
Union Grove, McIntosh and Starr’s Mill combined for 15 of the top 17 girls finishers. 
Northgate’s Caroline Nelson, who put together a solid ninth-place effort, joined Glorvigen as the Lady Vikings’ top-10 contributors. 
The team also picked up scorers from senior Erica Lee (21:19) and sophomores Sydney Tuttle (21:29) and Hannah Skiotis (21:30). 
Tuttle’s older brother, Andrew, crossed eighth in 16:45 to pace the Vikings finishers in a tight pack among the boys. Only 33 seconds separated Fultz’s win from McIntosh freshman Zach Jaeger (16:49) in 10th. 
Juniors Jaelin Rainey (15th, 16:55) and Sherman Dewey (17th, 17:00) paced the Vikings’ effort. Freshman Michael Nelson capped off the scoring in 30th place in 17:58. 
East Coweta and host Newnan will compete in Saturday’s Region 3- championships at the Newnan Utilities reservoir on Saturday. More
